title: Altri punti persi dal Real Madrid mentre McBurnie surclassa MbappÃƒÂ©
text: Fonte : justcalcio di 30 ago 2024 Altri punti persi dal Real Madrid mentre McBurnie surclassa MbappÃƒÂ© Altri punti persi dal Real Madrid mentre McBurnie surclassa MbappÃƒÂ© (Di venerdÃƒÂ¬ 30 agosto 2024) 2024-08-29 23:56:39 Fa notizia quanto pubblicato poco fa sul sito 101greatgoals: LÃ¢â‚¬â„¢arrugginito Real Madrid ÃƒÂ¨ sceso a quattro punti dal Barcellona nella Liga dopo essere stato bloccato sul punteggio di 1-1 a Las Palmas giovedÃƒÂ¬ sera. ÃƒË† stato il secondo pareggio in trasferta nelle prime tre partite dei Blancos a farli salire a cinque punti , mentre i loro acerrimi rivali hanno avuto un inizio perfetto. LÃ¢â‚¬â„¢attesa di Kylian MbappÃƒÂ© per un gol o un assist nella Liga si ÃƒÂ¨ prolungata per tre partite e la stella francese ÃƒÂ¨ stata probabilmente messa in ombra dallÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ex attaccante dello Sheffield United Oli McBurnie in una serata piovosa allÃ¢â‚¬â„¢Estadio de Gran Canaria. Oli McBurnie ha piÃƒÂ¹ gol coinvolti nella Liga (1) di Kylian MbappÃƒÂ© (0). foto.twitter. Leggi tutta la notizia su justcalcio Notizie su altre fonti Reazione a Catena, polemiche per lâ€™intesa vincente: â€œSolo due punti totalizzati, partita surrealeâ€ - Nella puntata di Reazione a Catena in onda il 23 agosto in molti hanno criticato le squadre che hanno partecipato alla sfida dell'intesa vincente. Su X scrivono: "Con soli 2 punti totalizzati cumulativamente fra le due squadre, quella di stasera ÃƒÂ¨ la peggiore intesa vincente di questa edizione"Continua a leggere . fanpage Espanyol-Real Sociedad (sabato 24 agosto 2024 ore 21:30): formazioni, quote, pronostici. I baschi cercano punti al CornellÃƒ - Per i Pericos, nessun particolare dramma: i catalani hanno giocato una partita comunque sufficiente, sono caduti al JosÃƒÂ¨ Zorrilla, sul campo di una squadra tosta come il Valladolid. Molto [Ã¢â‚¬Â¦] InfoBetting: Scommesse Sportive e Pronostici . Non ÃƒÂ¨ stato un bellÃ¢â‚¬â„¢avvio di Liga per Real Sociedad ed Espanyol: entrambe le squadre hanno perso allÃ¢â‚¬â„¢esordio e sono ancora a 0 punti in classifica. infobetting Sinner eliminato a Montreal, ha ancora problemi fisici: Jannik perde 800 punti in classifica - Preoccupano ancora le sue condizioni fisiche: Sinner ÃƒÂ¨ apparso stanco, probabilmente per i postumi della tonsillite, ma soprattutto si ÃƒÂ¨ toccato piÃƒÂ¹ volte l'anca precedentemente infortunata. Jannik Sinner ÃƒÂ¨ stato eliminato nei quarti di finale del torneo Masters 1000 di Montreal: il campione azzurro ha perso contro il russo Rublev. La sconfitta in Canada fa perdere ben 800 punti in classifica all'altoatesino. fanpage CONFERENCE, Fasce e date: tutto sul sorteggio - Passato con grande fatica lo scoglio dei playoff, la Fiorentina approda al nuovo girone unico della Conference League: 36 squadre totali, 6 partite da giocare da ottobre a dicembre, tre gare ... firenzeviola Real Madrid-Betis, le probabili formazioni: Ancelotti cerca il riscatto - Le probabili formazioni di real Madrid-Betis, match di scena allo stadio Bernabeu di Madrid valido per la quarta giornata della Liga ... sportnotizie24 MbappÃƒÂ© ancora a digiuno, il Real Madrid viene frenato dal Las Palmas 1-1 ed ÃƒÂ¨ giÃƒ a -4 dal Barcellona - LIGA - Il real Madrid viene ancora fermato sul pari alla terza giornata, questa volta in casa del Las Palmas. author: @EUTimesNET
title: Portland Residents Suffering From Deadly Disease Caused by Human Poop | EUTimes.NET âš¡ Hidden Story âš¡
text: Health official have warned of a massive surge in shigella cases in Portland due to the widespread contamination of human excrement in the city. Shigella is a deadly bacteria that spreads via fecal matter, and creates symptoms that include fever, stomach cramps, vomiting, and diarrhea. Some cases can become potentially fatal. â€œShigella spreads when one personâ€™s infected poop gets into another personâ€™s mouth through food or water, from objects or surfaces with shigella bacteria on them, or during sex,â€ Multnomah County said, according to KOIN 6. â€œShigella spreads very easily. Even a very small amount is enough to make someone sick.â€ [Thepostmillennial.com](https://thepostmillennial.com/portland-sees-increase-in-diseases-spread-by-human-waste) reports: Multnomah, Washington, and Clackamas counties have reported 45 cases of the bacteria in December, with nine different strains observed in the Portland metro area since October. The Portland Police Bureauâ€™s Central Bike Squad also joined in on the calls for awareness, making a post about hygiene on Instagram on Dec. 22. Previously, Multnomah County discovered a â€œclusterâ€ of drug-resistant shigella cases in November, with 16 cases found in the Portland metro area since September. A total of 218 cases have been reported in 2023, with the county saying that the majority of strains penetrate the region by way of international travelers and â€œsocial-sexual networks.â€ â€œLocal disease patterns suggest that fecal-oral spread through sexual contact may account for between half and more than two thirds of all cases without international travel. The rest are typically attributed to other types of person-to-person spread including outbreaks among populations with lack of hygiene, shelter, and sanitation, and among people who use illicit substances,â€ county officials explained to KOIN 6 News. The county added that â€œduring 2020 a single strain of Shigella caused multiple clusters among men who have sex with men, persons experiencing homelessness, as well as causing outbreaks at a food cart, and separately, a healthcare facility. Multnomah County epidemiology immediately identified these shifts into defined outbreaks and were successful in stopping illness spread from the food cart as well as within the healthcare facility.â€ The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports that there are approximately 450,000 shigella infections in the United States every year. Health officials say that while most people will recover from the illness within a week or two, symptoms can sometimes last longer and be more critical to those with weakened immune systems. RELATED ARTICLES [5G Causes Headaches, Stomach pain, difficulty Sleeping according to Swedish Study](https://www.eutimes.net/2023/12/5g-causes-headaches-stomach-pain-difficulty-sleeping-according-to-swedish-study/) [San Francisco Is Officially America's Worst City](https://www.eutimes.net/2023/09/san-francisco-is-officially-americas-worst-city/) [Former FBI Special Agent Left Homeless After Blowing Whistle On FBI & DOJ](https://www.eutimes.net/2023/05/former-fbi-special-agent-left-homeless-after-blowing-whistle-on-fbi-doj/) [African Suspect Arrested for Urinating on Homeless in Germany](https://www.eutimes.net/2023/04/african-suspect-arrested-for-urinating-on-homeless-in-germany/) [Democrats To Create Sanctuary State for Kids To Get Abortions and Sex Changes Without Parental Consent](https://www.eutimes.net/2023/03/democrats-to-create-sanctuary-state-for-kids-to-get-abortions-and-sex-changes-without-parental-consent/) [donation](https://www.eutimes.net/donations/)or [subscribing](https://feedburner.google.com/fb/a/mailverify?uri=TheEuropeanUnionTimes)to our Newsletter.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Box cutterâ€“armed robbers terrorize subway riders on 2 line
text:
By Glenn Schuck Adam Warner ,
4 hours ago
NEW YORK (1010 WINS/WCBS 880) â€“ Subway riders have been menaced with box cutters and mugged in a robbery spree on the 2 line in recent days, police said Thursday.
Images released by the NYPD shows the suspects linked to three armed robberies on the subway line in the Bronx over the past week. None of the victims were physically injured in the muggings, which all happened in the early morning hours, according to police.
The thieves have been targeted men on the 2 line in the early morning hours, police said. Photo credit NYPD The latest mugging was this past Tuesday, when a 22-year-old man was robbed on a northbound 2 train approaching the Nereid Avenue station at East 238th Street in the Wakefield section. The victim was threatened with a box cutter around 1:45 a.m. as a thief stole his phone and Apple AirPods.
Just two days before, on Sunday, a 26-year-old man was riding a northbound 2 train near the Gun Hill Road station in Williamsbridge around 1:35 a.m. when he too was menaced with a box cutter and robbed of his phone by one thief.
And last Thursday, a 50-year-old man was robbed on a northbound 2 train approaching the Bronx Park East station in Van Nest, police said. The victim was targeted around 1:45 a.m. by two men who simulated a weapon and stole his phone and wallet.
Anyone with information is asked to call Crime Stoppers at 1-800-577-TIPS.
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: ArcaMax Publishing, Inc.
title: Jewish students sue Columbia, Barnard over alleged antisemitism amid Gaza conflict | News & Features | ArcaMax Publishing
text:
NEW YORK â€” Jewish students are suing Columbia University and Barnard College over allegations of â€œsevereâ€ and â€œpervasiveâ€ antisemitism at the affiliated Manhattan institutions.
Itâ€™s the second lawsuit the firm Kasowitz Benson Torres has brought in Manhattan federal court against campus antisemitism since Hamasâ€™ Oct. 7 attack on Israel. Students sued New York University last semester over Jewish studentsâ€™ civil rights. Kasowitz has also targeted the University of Pennsylvania and Harvard University.
â€œColumbia continues to capitulate to pro-Hamas students and faculty, placing Columbiaâ€™s Jewish and Israeli community at risk,â€ said Marc Kasowitz, a lawyer for the plaintiffs. His statement continued to describe Columbia as a school â€œwhere hate and the promotion of violence is not just allowed but taught.â€
â€œOur lawsuit seeks to protect Jewish students by exposing and expunging the antisemitic virus that permeates Columbiaâ€™s campus and classrooms,â€ he said.
The action comes just weeks after a Republican-led U.S. House of Representatives committee announced its own antisemitism probe, citing â€œgrave concernsâ€ about Columbiaâ€™s response. The university was asked to submit documents by Monday, including all reports of antisemitic incidents since 2021, disciplinary records and internal communications.
Spokespeople for Columbia and Barnard declined to comment on pending litigation.
As the war has continued and killed tens of thousands of people in the Middle East, Columbia students have responded with a steady drumbeat of demonstrations.
Pro-Palestinian students have been targeted with â€œdoxxingâ€ trucks and reported that a sickening spray at a campus rally sent them seeking medical attention. Two former Columbia students are being investigated as suspects, while a protest just outside the universityâ€™s gates over its response to the incident led to multiple arrests.
 During the protests, the 114-page lawsuit alleges that Jewish students were subjected to antisemitic chants including â€œJews will not defeat us,â€ and spat at, physically assaulted and threatened on campus and social media with epithets.
The five named plaintiffs are all Jewish at Columbiaâ€™s undergraduate and graduate schools, and one holds Israeli dual citizenship. Others are unnamed members of pro-Israel nonprofits who attend Columbia and Barnard.
â€œWhat is most striking about all of this is Columbiaâ€™s abject failure and deliberate refusal to lift a finger to stop and deter this outrageous antisemitic conduct and discipline the students and faculty who perpetrate it,â€ read the lawsuit.
The group of students said the result is a â€œdouble standard invidious to Jews and Israelis,â€ as the university selectively enforces its policies and hires professors who teach that Jewish Israelis are oppressors, with little space for discussion of the religious peopleâ€™s complicated history of persecution. Two pro-Palestinian student groups have been kicked off campus for not following university policies.
â€œColumbia has permitted endemic antisemitism to exclude Jewish and Israeli students from full and equal participation in, and to deprive them of the full and equal benefits of, their educational experience at Columbia,â€ they said in court documents.
The plaintiffs are asking for monetary damages and a federal judge to force Columbia to implement specific and institutional remedial measures.

author: Taiwo Oshunloye
title: Scholarship, healthcare, gadgets... gifts pour in for viral woman Mum Zee
text: Gifts have kept pouring in for Deborah Loveth (Mum Zee), the lady who became a sensation on X for waking up very early to cook for her husband. Mum Zee [went viral](https://lifestyle.thecable.ng/x-users-gift-over-n2m-to-lady-criticised-for-cooking-for-husband-at-450-am/) after she disclosed the reason she gets up from bed at 4:50 am to prepare her husbandâ€™s lunch. The lady said she made it a daily routine after her husband told her his colleague (a female) brought two spoons with her food to work so they could eat together. The tweet sparked arguments on social media. While some users criticised her over the routine others tackled her husband for eating out in the first instance. Amid the criticism, some users on X rallied support and donations for Mum Zee. Mum Zee later [revealed](https://lifestyle.thecable.ng/x-users-gift-over-n2m-to-lady-criticised-for-cooking-for-husband-at-450-am/) that the donations had passed over N2 million. Loveth has also received several gifts courtesy of celebrities, brands, and X users. Some of the gifts include a movie date at Filmhouse cinemas, a yearâ€™s supply of insecticide, free antenatal and delivery care, scholarships to study abroad, health insurance, and legal representation for one year. The expecting mother also received maternity gowns, toiletries, provisions, data and Netflix subscriptions, electricity bills, cryptocurrency, airtime, a yearâ€™s supply of diapers, and family care insurance in Oyo state. Other gifts range from phones, bed frames, home appliances, laptops, food items, window blinds, TV stands, mattresses, rugs, artworks, jerseys and clothing items for herself and her husband. Nigerian couple breaks the internet with viral love story on X. A Nigerian woman, Mummy Zee and her husband, Mr. Adebisi have been gifted scholarships, furnitures, a freezer, window blind, website, AC, free web designing classes, data analysis classes and over N3 million afterâ€¦ [pic.twitter.com/UfTYrcujEB]Advertisement â€” Africa Facts Zone (@AfricaFactsZone) [January 6, 2024] Mum Zee also took to X to thank some of the persons, brands, and firms that have sent her gifts. Thank God I've not deleted all [@Tspiceskitchen]recipe videos. Thank you Sucre mamitoğŸ¥ºğŸ¥ºğŸ¥ºğŸ™ğŸ½ğŸ™ğŸ½ [https://t.co/bbP1P2ohmQ] â€” MumZeeâœ¨ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡¬ (@_Debbie_OA) [January 7, 2024] SIR DICKS N [@Wizarab10]this tv is big o, ahhhh, we'll have to move out. author: @ina__news
title: Zionist settlement and two military headquarters are bombed by Hezbollah Â» Iraqi News Agency
text: Follow-up - INA The Lebanese Hezbollah announced, today, Thursday, the bombing of a Zionist settlement and two military headquarters. The party said in successive statements that "the Islamic Resistance fighters bombed the Ahihud settlement with 50 rockets in support of Palestine and in defense of Lebanon and its people.". It added that "the Islamic Resistance fighters also bombed the headquarters of the Northern Region Command in the Dado base with waves of rockets, as well as the reserve headquarters of the Northern Corps and the Galilee Division's base and warehouses in Amiad." [ Hezbollah declares bombing of a colony and a Zionist intelligence headquarters ](https://ina.iq/eng/35043-hezbollah-declares-bombing-of-a-colony-and-a-zionist-intelligence-headquarters.html) [ Antarcticaâ€™s 'doomsday' glacier is heading for catastrophic collapse ](https://ina.iq/eng/34876-antarcticas-doomsday-glacier-is-heading-for-catastrophic-collapse.html) [ PM: Pushing forward the relations between Iraq and Somalia is necessary ](https://ina.iq/eng/34979-pm-pushing-forward-relations-between-iraq-and-somalia-is-necessary.html)

author: El Destape
title: InclusiÃ³n digital: cÃ³mo logro Quintela aumentar las conexiones a internet en La Rioja
text:
En el tercer trimestre de 2024 se registraron 428.453 accesos a internet en la provincia de [La Rioja](https://www.eldestapeweb.com/tag/el-destape-la-rioja). De ese total, 318.303 corresponden a accesos mÃ³viles (en dispositivos celulares) y los 110.150 restantes son accesos fijos (computadoras en hogares, comercios y empresas). En base a este dato, la provincia marcÃ³ un crecimiento del 2% en relaciÃ³n al mismo periodo del aÃ±o pasado.
Lo que no se modifica es que existen mÃ¡s conexiones mÃ³viles que fijas (la misma tendencia se reproduce en el resto del paÃ­s) y son mÃ¡s los accesos que los habitantes determinados por el censo nacional, lo cual expresa que existen personas con mÃ¡s de una conexiÃ³n, algo que tambiÃ©n ocurre en las otras provincias argentinas.
El censo del aÃ±o pasado determinÃ³ que existen 383.865 habitantes riojanos y se estableciÃ³ con este informe del INDEC mÃ¡s de 400 mil accesos a internet en el territorio riojano. A nivel paÃ­s el incremento porcentual promedio quedÃ³ por debajo de La Rioja, con un 1,5% respecto a septiembre de 2023.
El Gobierno de la provincia amplÃ­a la conexiÃ³n en todo el territorio
A partir del trabajo conjunto entre el Gobierno provincial de [La Rioja](https://www.eldestapeweb.com/tag/el-destape-la-rioja) y una cooperativa local, se llevÃ³ a cabo la instalaciÃ³n de un tendido de fibra Ã³ptica en la localidad de Santa LucÃ­a, en el Departamento Chamical, que beneficia a mÃ¡s de 11 familias del puesto El Alto con el servicio de internet de alta calidad.
Es importante destacar la participaciÃ³n activa de los vecinos de El Alto que dieron un paso fundamental en su inclusiÃ³n digital, eliminando las barreras que histÃ³ricamente dificultaron su desarrollo. A partir de la instalaciÃ³n de la fibra Ã³ptica se proveyÃ³ de conectividad a las familias de la zona un servicio que es clave para la educaciÃ³n, la comunicaciÃ³n y la realizaciÃ³n de trÃ¡mites digitales.
Bajo esta lÃ­nea, se conectaron antenas de televisiÃ³n satelital en cada uno de los hogares, garantizando el acceso a diversos contenidos culturales y educativos con el objetivo de la democratizaciÃ³n de la informaciÃ³n. Estas iniciativas reflejan el firme compromiso del Gobierno de La Rioja para cerrar la brecha digital, uno de los objetivos plasmados en la nueva ConstituciÃ³n Provincial.
Esta iniciativa tambiÃ©n se llevÃ³ a cabo en el paraje Las Cortaderas, ubicado en el departamento General Ocampo. Esta iniciativa forma parte de la polÃ­tica provincial destinada a extender los recursos de conectividad a todo el territorio, beneficiando a 20 familias de la zona rural. Con esta mejora, los residentes podrÃ¡n ampliar su comunicaciÃ³n y acceder a informaciÃ³n vital, lo que representa un paso significativo hacia la reducciÃ³n de la brecha digital en La Rioja.
Desde el Gobierno provincial destacaron que la iniciativa de llevar internet a ese punto superÃ³ las dificultades geogrÃ¡ficas. AdemÃ¡s, detallaron que serÃ¡n 20 familias de la zona, mÃ¡s la Escuela NÂ° 220 de "Las Cortaderas", y la Sala de Primeros Auxilios, quienes accederÃ¡n a esta conexiÃ³n. SegÃºn indicaron, este logro se debe al esfuerzo de la comunidad de Las Cortaderas; la DirecciÃ³n de InformatizaciÃ³n de La Comunidad, dependiente de la SecretarÃ­a de Relaciones Con La Comunidad; la SecretarÃ­a General de La GobernaciÃ³n; el Ministerio de Transporte y Comunicaciones; y la empresa del Estado Internet Para Todos
